S2Generator.params package#

Subpackages#

S2Generator.params.series_params module#

This module mainly stores the parameters used to control the generation of the stimulus time series.

Created on 2025/08/19 11:06:31 @author: Whenxuan Wang @email: wwhenxuan@gmail.com @url: wwhenxuan/S2Generator

class S2Generator.params.series_params.SeriesParams(mixed_distribution: float | None = 0.1, autoregressive_moving_average: float | None = 0.2, forecast_pfn: float | None = 0.35, kernel_synth: float | None = 0.25, intrinsic_mode_function: float | None = 0.1, min_centroids: int | None = 3, max_centroids: int | None = 8, rotate: bool | None = False, gaussian: bool | None = True, uniform: bool | None = True, mixed_distribution_dict: ~typing.Dict[str, float] | None = None, mixed_distribution_list: ~typing.List[float] | None = None, p_min: int | None = 1, p_max: int | None = 3, q_min: int | None = 1, q_max: int | None = 5, upper_bound: float = 512, is_sub_day: bool | None = True, transition: bool | None = True, start_time: str | None = '1885-01-01', end_time: str | None = None, random_walk: bool = False, min_kernels: int | None = 1, max_kernels: int | None = 5, exp_sine_squared: bool | None = True, dot_product: bool | None = True, rbf: bool | None = True, rational_quadratic: bool | None = True, white_kernel: bool | None = True, constant_kernel: bool | None = True, min_base_imfs: int = 1, max_base_imfs: int = 3, min_choice_imfs: int = 2, max_choice_imfs: int = 5, imfs_dict: ~typing.Dict[str, float] | None = None, imfs_list: ~typing.List[float] | None = None, min_duration: float = 0.5, max_duration: float = 10.0, min_amplitude: float = 0.01, max_amplitude: float = 10.0, min_frequency: float = 0.01, max_frequency: float = 8.0, noise_level: float = 0.01, dtype: ~numpy.dtype = <class 'numpy.float64'>)[source]#

Bases: object

Parameter Control The Generation of Excitation Time Series in S2 (Series-Symbol) Data Generation

__init__(mixed_distribution: float | None = 0.1, autoregressive_moving_average: float | None = 0.2, forecast_pfn: float | None = 0.35, kernel_synth: float | None = 0.25, intrinsic_mode_function: float | None = 0.1, min_centroids: int | None = 3, max_centroids: int | None = 8, rotate: bool | None = False, gaussian: bool | None = True, uniform: bool | None = True, mixed_distribution_dict: ~typing.Dict[str, float] | None = None, mixed_distribution_list: ~typing.List[float] | None = None, p_min: int | None = 1, p_max: int | None = 3, q_min: int | None = 1, q_max: int | None = 5, upper_bound: float = 512, is_sub_day: bool | None = True, transition: bool | None = True, start_time: str | None = '1885-01-01', end_time: str | None = None, random_walk: bool = False, min_kernels: int | None = 1, max_kernels: int | None = 5, exp_sine_squared: bool | None = True, dot_product: bool | None = True, rbf: bool | None = True, rational_quadratic: bool | None = True, white_kernel: bool | None = True, constant_kernel: bool | None = True, min_base_imfs: int = 1, max_base_imfs: int = 3, min_choice_imfs: int = 2, max_choice_imfs: int = 5, imfs_dict: ~typing.Dict[str, float] | None = None, imfs_list: ~typing.List[float] | None = None, min_duration: float = 0.5, max_duration: float = 10.0, min_amplitude: float = 0.01, max_amplitude: float = 10.0, min_frequency: float = 0.01, max_frequency: float = 8.0, noise_level: float = 0.01, dtype: ~numpy.dtype = <class 'numpy.float64'>)[source]#
Parameters:

  • mixed_distribution – The probability of generating using the mixed distribution sampling.

  • autoregressive_moving_average – The probability of generating using the autoregressive moving average.

  • forecast_pfn – The probability of generating using the forecast pattern.

  • kernel_synth – The probability of generating using the kernel synthesis.

  • intrinsic_mode_function – The probability of generating using the intrinsic mode function.

  • min_centroids – Minimum number of distributions used in mixture distribution sampling.

  • max_centroids – Maximum number of distributions used in mixture distribution sampling.

  • rotate – Whether to rotate the generated distribution or not.

  • gaussian – Whether to use Gaussian distribution in mixed distribution sampling.

  • uniform – Whether to use uniform distribution in mixed distribution sampling.

  • mixed_distribution_dict – A dictionary that determines the probability of a certain distribution being sampled in a mixed distribution.

  • mixed_distribution_list – A list that determines the probability of a certain distribution being sampled from a mixed distribution.

  • p_min – Minimum value for the AR(p) process in Autoregressive model.

  • p_max – Maximum value for the AR(p) process in Autoregressive model.

  • q_min – Minimum value for the MA(q) process in Moving Average model.

  • q_max – Maximum value for the MA(q) process in Moving Average model.

  • upper_bound – Upper bound for the ARMA(p, q) process.

  • is_sub_day – Enable sub-daily frequency components (minutes/hours).

  • transition – Enable smooth transitions between frequency components.

  • start_time – Start timestamp for generated series (ISO format: YYYY-MM-DD).

  • end_time – End timestamp for generated series. Uses current date if None.

  • random_walk – Enable random walk transformation for non-stationary series.

  • min_kernels – The minimum number of kernels to use.

  • max_kernels – Max number of kernels for the input distribution in KernelSynth methods.

  • exp_sine_squared – Boolean, whether to use the exponential square root of kernel.

  • dot_product – Boolean, whether to use the dot product of kernel length and kernel.

  • rbf – Boolean, whether to use the RBF kernel.

  • rational_quadratic – Boolean, whether to use the rational quadratic kernel.

  • white_kernel – Boolean, whether to use the white kernel.

  • constant_kernel – Boolean, whether to use the constant kernel.

  • min_base_imfs – Minimum number of fundamental IMF components to generate.

  • max_base_imfs – Maximum number of fundamental IMF components to generate.

  • min_choice_imfs – Minimum number of IntrinsicModeFunction to select from available types.

  • max_choice_imfs – Maximum number of IntrinsicModeFunction to select from available types.

  • probability_dict – Custom probability distribution for IMF types, with keys matching available IMF names.

  • probability_list – Custom probability weights for IMF types in predefined order (overrides probability_dict).

  • min_duration – Minimum signal duration in seconds.

  • max_duration – Maximum signal duration in seconds.

  • min_amplitude – Minimum amplitude for generated signal components.

  • max_amplitude – Maximum amplitude for generated signal components.

  • min_frequency – Minimum frequency for signal components (Hz).

  • max_frequency – Maximum frequency for signal components (Hz).

  • noise_level – Amplitude of Gaussian noise to add (relative to signal amplitude).

property prob_array: ndarray#

Obtaining the sampling probability of time series data with different incentive methods.

property sampling_methods: List[str]#

Returns a list of various sampling methods

S2Generator.params.symbol_params module#

This module is mainly used to store parameters that control the generation of symbolic expressions.

Created on 2025/08/19 11:07:39 @author: Whenxuan Wang @email: wwhenxuan@gmail.com @url: wwhenxuan/S2Generator

class S2Generator.params.symbol_params.SymbolParams(max_trials: int | None = 64, prob_rand: float | None = 0.25, prob_const: float | None = 0.25, min_binary_ops_per_dim: int | None = 0, max_binary_ops_per_dim: int | None = 1, max_binary_ops_offset: int | None = 4, min_unary_ops: int | None = 0, max_unary_ops: int | None = 5, float_precision: int | None = 3, mantissa_len: int | None = 1, max_int: int | None = 10, max_exponent: int | None = 3, max_exponent_prefactor: int | None = 1, use_abs: bool | None = True, operators_to_downsample: str | None = None, max_unary_depth: int | None = 6, required_operators: str | None = '', extra_unary_operators: str | None = '', extra_binary_operators: str | None = '', extra_constants: str | None = '', use_sympy: bool | None = False, reduce_num_constants: bool | None = True, solve_diff: int | None = 0, decimals: int | None = 6, min_input_dimension: int | None = 1, max_input_dimension: int | None = 6, min_output_dimension: int | None = 1, max_output_dimension: int | None = 12)[source]#

Bases: object

Parameter Control The Generation of Complex Systems (Symbolic Expression) in S2 (Series-Symbol) Data Generation.

__init__(max_trials: int | None = 64, prob_rand: float | None = 0.25, prob_const: float | None = 0.25, min_binary_ops_per_dim: int | None = 0, max_binary_ops_per_dim: int | None = 1, max_binary_ops_offset: int | None = 4, min_unary_ops: int | None = 0, max_unary_ops: int | None = 5, float_precision: int | None = 3, mantissa_len: int | None = 1, max_int: int | None = 10, max_exponent: int | None = 3, max_exponent_prefactor: int | None = 1, use_abs: bool | None = True, operators_to_downsample: str | None = None, max_unary_depth: int | None = 6, required_operators: str | None = '', extra_unary_operators: str | None = '', extra_binary_operators: str | None = '', extra_constants: str | None = '', use_sympy: bool | None = False, reduce_num_constants: bool | None = True, solve_diff: int | None = 0, decimals: int | None = 6, min_input_dimension: int | None = 1, max_input_dimension: int | None = 6, min_output_dimension: int | None = 1, max_output_dimension: int | None = 12) → None[source]#
Parameters:

  • max_trials – Maximum number of trials to generate.

  • prob_rand – Probability to generate n in leafs.

  • prob_const – Probability to generate integer in leafs.

  • min_binary_ops_per_dim – Min number of binary operators per input dimension.

  • max_binary_ops_per_dim – Max number of binary operators per input dimension.

  • max_binary_ops_offset – Offset for max number of binary operators.

  • min_unary_ops – Min number of unary operators.

  • max_unary_ops – Max number of unary operators.

  • float_precision – Number of digits in the mantissa.

  • mantissa_len – Number of tokens for the mantissa (must be a divisor or float_precision+1).

  • max_int – Maximal integer in symbolic expressions.

  • max_exponent – Maximal order of magnitude.

  • max_exponent_prefactor – Maximal order of magnitude in prefactors.

  • use_abs – Whether to replace log and sqrt by log(abs) and sqrt(abs).

  • operators_to_downsample – Which operator to remove.

  • max_unary_depth – Max number of operators inside unary.

  • required_operators – Which operator to remove.

  • extra_unary_operators – Extra unary operator to add to data generation.

  • extra_binary_operators – Extra binary operator to add to data generation.

  • extra_constants – Additional int constants floats instead of ints.

  • use_sympy – Whether to use sympy parsing (basic simplification).

  • reduce_num_constants – Use minimal amount of constants in eqs.

  • solve_diff – Order of differential equation solving (0: no diff, 1: first order, etc.).

  • decimals – Number of digits reserved for floating-point numbers in symbolic expressions.

  • min_input_dimension – Minimum input dimension (minimum number of variables) for symbolic expressions

  • max_input_dimension – Maximum input dimension of symbolic expressions (maximum number of variables)

  • min_output_dimension – Minimum output dimension of multivariate symbolic expressions

  • max_output_dimension – Maximum output dimension of multivariate symbolic expressions

fix_inputs_prob_rand() → None[source]#

Control the probability of random number generation for input not to be too large

property operators_to_downsample: str#

Get the string of operators to be removed.

S2Generator.params.symbol_params.check_inputs_probability(probability: float) → float[source]#

Check if probability is between 0 and 1.

Parameters:

probability – The user inputs probability.

Returns:

The legal probability.

Module contents#

This module is used for parameter control and management, including parameter control for generating stimulus time series and generating symbolic expressions (parameter control for complex systems).

Created on 2025/08/19 11:03:53” @author: Whenxuan Wang @email: wwhenxuan@gmail.com @url: wwhenxuan/S2Generator

class S2Generator.params.SeriesParams(mixed_distribution: float | None = 0.1, autoregressive_moving_average: float | None = 0.2, forecast_pfn: float | None = 0.35, kernel_synth: float | None = 0.25, intrinsic_mode_function: float | None = 0.1, min_centroids: int | None = 3, max_centroids: int | None = 8, rotate: bool | None = False, gaussian: bool | None = True, uniform: bool | None = True, mixed_distribution_dict: ~typing.Dict[str, float] | None = None, mixed_distribution_list: ~typing.List[float] | None = None, p_min: int | None = 1, p_max: int | None = 3, q_min: int | None = 1, q_max: int | None = 5, upper_bound: float = 512, is_sub_day: bool | None = True, transition: bool | None = True, start_time: str | None = '1885-01-01', end_time: str | None = None, random_walk: bool = False, min_kernels: int | None = 1, max_kernels: int | None = 5, exp_sine_squared: bool | None = True, dot_product: bool | None = True, rbf: bool | None = True, rational_quadratic: bool | None = True, white_kernel: bool | None = True, constant_kernel: bool | None = True, min_base_imfs: int = 1, max_base_imfs: int = 3, min_choice_imfs: int = 2, max_choice_imfs: int = 5, imfs_dict: ~typing.Dict[str, float] | None = None, imfs_list: ~typing.List[float] | None = None, min_duration: float = 0.5, max_duration: float = 10.0, min_amplitude: float = 0.01, max_amplitude: float = 10.0, min_frequency: float = 0.01, max_frequency: float = 8.0, noise_level: float = 0.01, dtype: ~numpy.dtype = <class 'numpy.float64'>)[source]#
